image.altText: police car

props.synopsis: Police allege the man used a sword during the altercation which took place last night at Oaks Estate.

title.children: Man charged after allegedly severing neighbour's finger with sword

image.altText: The exterior of a building with NDIS signage prominently displayed on the outside. Location is not specific.

props.synopsis: A record fine has been handed down to an NDIS service provider after a man choked and died in its care.

title.children: NDIS provider given record fine after man died choking on sandwich

image.altText: A woman holds a sign at a Brisbane pro-choice rally in May.

props.synopsis: For more than a decade, women walking into the abortion clinic in Queanbeyan have been greeted by Annie Collins, but the manager of Gynaecology Centres Australia's Queanbeyan clinic fears her days supporting women through surgical abortions could be numbered.

title.children: The unintended consequence of free abortions in the ACT

image.altText: Hadi Nazari places a thumbs up while in a helicopter.

props.synopsis: Hadi Nazari told the hikers who found him after two weeks missing in the NSW bush that he used journal entries in a logbook inside a mountain hut to plan his route to safety.

title.children: Logbooks found in remote hut helped hiker Hadi Nazari find rescuers

image.altText: A photo of a person in an online meeting with the person's head is blurred.

props.synopsis: The explanation was questioned by one federal MP who said there is "no such thing as a superficial Nazi salute".

title.children: ANU says students did not make anti-Semitic gestures during online meeting

image.altText: Kathryn holds up her x-ray and looks at it. It looks like the harbour bridge from a bird's eye view.

props.synopsis: Bone is the most transplanted tissue after blood but bone banks are constantly short of donors, with only 10 per cent of people who have hip replacements opting-in to donate.

title.children: Most don't donate bone from hip replacement despite not changing surgery

image.altText: artist render of what the proposed development near City Hill would look like

props.synopsis: The site, which is not far from Lake Burley Griffin, will eventually be home to a park, offices, a hotel and 500 apartments.

title.children: Canberra block sold for $66 million to be turned into apartments, hotel

image.altText: a man in a murky lake

props.synopsis: It's not all algae and ducks in Lake Burley Griffin, as this open water swimmer will tell you.

title.children: Joseph swims weekly in Lake Burley Griffin, but he knows the dangers

image.altText: Alex de Minaur closes his eyes on the court during an Australian Open quarterfinal against Jannik Sinner.

props.synopsis: A night that promised so much for Alex de Minaur ended with another trip back to the drawing board following a loss that will require some serious soul-searching.

title.children: De Minaur's harsh reality after being 'slapped across the face' by Sinner

image.altText: Myer

props.synopsis: Myer shareholders have voted in favour of a merger with Premier's Apparel Brands, while Wall Street's benchmark index, the S&P 500, briefly touched a fresh record high. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Myer shareholders vote to support merger, S&P 500 near a record high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian share market drops 0.4pc in early trade
Premier's proxy votes also overwhelmingly in favour of Myer merger deal
Government becomes major creditor of Rex Airlines after acquiring $50 million debt

image.altText: A black cloud of smoke advances over yellow grassland with a fire line visible.

props.synopsis: About 19,000 people have been ordered to evacuate from the area near Castaic Lake as hot winds fan the flames.

title.children: New wildfire breaks out north of Los Angeles

image.altText: Three black plastic kitchen utensils including a spatula and a spoon

props.synopsis: Chemosphere – a peer-reviewed scientific journal – was forced to issue a correction after scientists made a major error calculating the toxicity of black plastic kitchen utensils.

title.children: 'Insanely embarrassing': Scientific paper corrects study on black utensils

image.altText: A woman and two children stand with a shopping trolley

props.synopsis: Yasmin Baira says feeding her family is more challenging than ever as the cost of some grocery items has more than doubled over the past 15 years.

title.children: Analysis shows price of spag bol has risen 60 per cent in 15 years

image.altText: A projection on buildings shows an outline of Donald Trump's hair being blown by a wind turbine, with the words FUTURE VS TRUMP

props.synopsis: President Donald Trump has wasted no time dismantling climate policies and promising a new era of fossil-fuel dominance, withdrawing the US from the Paris Agreement on his first day back in office.

title.children: Trump's return is bad news for climate, but US will feel the pinch

image.altText: Carolyn Heise

props.synopsis: Ahead of the next federal election, a sophisticated grassroots campaign is again looking to shake up the two-party system and break the major parties' decades-long stranglehold on blue-ribbon seats. This time, some community independents will have the added assistance of a brand new fundraising vehicle.

title.children: 'Nationals aren't the party they once were': Campaign to flip safe seats

image.altText: Prince Harry in a navy blue suit with a silver tie.

props.synopsis: The lawsuit was settled amid News Group Newspapers offering a "full apology".

title.children: Prince Harry settles lawsuit against British tabloids

image.altText: Shop building on street with police tape

props.synopsis: Detectives are continuing to investigate "suspicious" fires in Sydney's east in October believed to be linked to the recent spate of alleged anti-Semitic arson attacks in the city.

title.children: Man charged by police investigating anti-Semitic attacks discussed payment

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Ben Shelton speaks into a microphone during an Australian Open interview.

props.synopsis: After booking his maiden Australian Open semifinal spot, Ben Shelton took it upon himself to take aim at tennis broadcasters and on-court interviewers over their line of questioning to players.

title.children: Shelton joins Djokovic in calling out Aus Open broadcasters over 'negativity'

image.altText: Two men with black hair smile widely while holding each others arms and hands while looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Thailand is the first country in South-East Asia to legalise same-sex marriage.

title.children: Thai same-sex couples prepare to marry on historic day

image.altText: A white man wearing a suit and tie, highlighted against a dark crowded background

props.synopsis: Politicians aren’t afraid of complaining privately about the public thinking they’re not productive, now they've got a chance to change that.

title.children: Women poured their hearts out, but the government still hasn't replied

image.altText: Anti-Semitic graffiti mentioning Hitler and showing a swastika along a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The firebomb attack on a childcare centre was the eighth anti-Semitic attack in Sydney in just three months. Is enough being done to stop the crimes and are our political leaders making things better or worse?

title.children: ABC News Daily: How politicians are failing on anti-Semitism

image.altText: An illustration of a supermarket, with lots of bright colours and range of products.

props.synopsis: The grocery aisle is a dizzying array of colourful packaging, but most of it is made of virgin materials. So what happens to the carefully collected packaging after it's put in the recycling?

title.children: How much of the cans and jars you buy has been recycled?

image.altText: A crowd of people gathered around a bunch of candles at night wearing winter coats

props.synopsis: The suspect is a failed asylum seeker who was meant to have left the country, authorities say.

title.children: Two-year-old child among dead in 'kitchen knife' stabbing in southern Germany

image.altText: Emma Navarro, Ben Shelton and Kim Birrell at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: A missed double-bounce call, an unseeded Italian hits one of the shots of his life and an all-Australian final is locked in. Here are five quick hits from day 11 of the Australian Open.

title.children: Five quick hits: A physics bending shot and Aussies rule mixed doubles

image.altText: Strip of suburban homes on street, grey houses, blue skies, scattered clouds.

props.synopsis: The motto "persistence pays" has come true for Henri van Riet who shaved off more than $2,500 by refusing to take no for an answer.

title.children: Persistence helps home owner avoid insurance 'loyalty tax'

image.altText: A young girl uses a laptop

props.synopsis: Access to a laptop is increasingly important for education. But, figuring out what you need to purchase and what your state's or territory's device requirement is can be expensive and confusing.

title.children: Here are the rules on student laptops in each state and territory

image.altText: A train passes along a track against a grey sky with green foliage running up alongside the tracks

props.synopsis: Local media reported that a passenger had pulled an "alarm chain" on the train causing passengers to disembark into the path of another oncoming train.

title.children: Indian train passengers jump to deaths after rumours of fire

image.altText: A picturesque landscape of a town built around a large hill filled with greenery.

props.synopsis: As demand for healthcare outstrips supply, some country towns have been offering huge incentives to attract doctors but other shires have raised concerns about being unable to retain or attract GPs because they can't afford it.

title.children: The 'bidding war' for Australia's GPs isn't fair and it's set to escalate

image.altText: the exterior of a white apartment building

props.synopsis: A top strata management firm under investigation for charging clients excessive fees is arguing for a raft of changes to the draft findings of an independent review into its business practices, before the final report is made public.

title.children: Inside investigation into top strata firm accused of rorting apartment owners

image.altText: Emergency workers and fire trucks out the front of a charred, multi-storey hotel after a fire.

props.synopsis: Authorities have now detained nine people following the fire, which ripped through a ski resort in western Türkiye earlier this week.

title.children: Twenty children among 76 killed in Türkiye resort fire disaster

image.altText: A cartoon cat.

props.synopsis: Before Mickey Mouse, Felix the Cat was the biggest thing in animation. But behind the success of the cartoon cat, his creator lived a controversial and tragic life.

title.children: Felix the Cat shone on screen — but his creator had dark secrets

image.altText: GettyImages-2193632498

props.synopsis: Sydney Thunder spinner Tanveer Singha says local rivals the Sixers are vulnerable ahead of a massive Big Bash clash.

title.children: 'Scared to face us': Thunder spinner hits out at Sixers ahead Big Bash battle

image.altText: three kids with lifejackets in a river

props.synopsis: High temperatures are continuing across the state with a reprieve expected on the weekend for the south-east as the outback swelters and Longreach set to reach 45C.

title.children: 'Very warm and sticky' Queensland heat to continue as thunderstorms develop

image.altText: A man and woman holding a photo of a woman

props.synopsis: The Victorian coroner has indicated he will not hold a public inquest into the death of Caitlin Wainrib, but acknowledges there are more questions than answers over her death.

title.children: Public inquest unlikely despite Melbourne family's fears of foul play
